channel.title: MooZar Aims To Turn Pirates Into Paying Customers
channel.description:
The operators of MooZar, a new service set to launch at the end of February, believe they have the solution to the file-sharing piracy ‘problem’. Illicit downloaders can apparently go to their site, pay some money and feel happy in the knowledge that they’ve supported the artist. Controversially, there are suggestions they won’t get sued either.
[URL=http://torrentfreak.com/moozar-aims-to-turn-pirates-into-paying-customers-100214/?utm_source=feedburner&utm_medium=feed&utm_campaign=Feed%3A+Torrentfreak+%28Torrentfreak%29]more[/URL]

item.title: MooZar Aims To Turn Pirates Into Paying Customers
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“eczema3, post:29, topic:329461”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=425849.msg3129606#msg3129606 date=1266344608]

[quote author=MujaheD link=topic=425849.msg3129587#msg3129587 date=1266343155]

I wouldn’t want to support the artist nor the record company. I’d pirate music or movies only because I know it’s useless junk that ends up making uneducated people rich. Sure I enjoy it, but I don’t think it’s worth any money.

We shouldn’t waste our wealth on industries that don’t bring any benefit to mankind.
[/quote]lold you do realize not all media is “useless junk”?

Really? Are you sure about that? How could anyone playing a guitar benefit anyone?

Even if it’s a little benefit, they certainly don’t deserve the millions that they get.
[/quote]A world without music would be chaotic. Entertainment is a neccessity for humans, otherwise we’d all be stressed constantly

I’d think otherwise. What about the thousands of years before anyone thought of music? It’s not been around since the dawn of time you know.[/quote]Refer to what mopman said.

Read full topic
item.source: MooZar Aims To Turn Pirates Into Paying Customers

item.title: MooZar Aims To Turn Pirates Into Paying Customers
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:21, topic:329461”]I love it when someone takes a statement that I make and twists it into something absurd, such as advocacy for terrorism. Good work.
Now, are all Swedes stupid enough to make such an outlandish statement, or is this statement equally stupid?

Bottom line is that, sooner or later, for better or for worse, the music/movie industries WILL change their approach as we, the public, dictate. I’ll seek solace in that fact. :)[/quote]When the public has unacceptable demands nothing will change. Especially not with people like me around who keep buying shit even though prices are high.

Read full topic

item.description:
@lothy wrote:

I love it when someone takes a statement that I make and twists it into something absurd, such as advocacy for terrorism. Good work.
Now, are all Swedes stupid enough to make such an outlandish statement, or is this statement equally stupid?

Bottom line is that, sooner or later, for better or for worse, the music/movie industries WILL change their approach as we, the public, dictate. I’ll seek solace in that fact.

item.title: MooZar Aims To Turn Pirates Into Paying Customers
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:19, topic:329461”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=425849.msg3129360#msg3129360 date=1266304229]

Itunes had DRM up until very recently IIRC. Aren’t all of their downloads also the apple proprietary file format – AAC? Who wants to be subject to vendor lock in when they don’t have to be?
[/quote]Stop being so stubborn and convert their format or use Amazon. You seem to use open source as a justification for piracy which is retarded

No. I refuse to be inconvenienced. And I’m not confirming or denying that I take part in piracy.

If I were to pirate stuff, it would be because the pricing is outrageous or because I’m sick of the fact that Americans get everything weeks or months in advance.
I think it’s good that there are people who pirate out there, because it is slowly but surely disciplining the associated industries.[/quote]The price wouldn’t be this high if it wasn’t for piracy… look at the 90’s, prices were way lower. When internet reached acceptable speeds for home users the prices shot through the roof, i wonder why…

Oh by the way, by your logics terrorism could be considered an act of good. “I think it’s good that there are people who blow themselves up out there, because it is slowly but surely disciplining the associated governments.”

Read full topic
item.source: MooZar Aims To Turn Pirates Into Paying Customers

item.title: MooZar Aims To Turn Pirates Into Paying Customers
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:18, topic:329461”][quote author=Lothy link=topic=425849.msg3129302#msg3129302 date=1266295481]
Itunes had DRM up until very recently IIRC. Aren’t all of their downloads also the apple proprietary file format – AAC? Who wants to be subject to vendor lock in when they don’t have to be?
[/quote]Stop being so stubborn and convert their format or use Amazon. You seem to use open source as a justification for piracy which is retarded[/quote]
No. I refuse to be inconvenienced. And I’m not confirming or denying that I take part in piracy.

If I were to pirate stuff, it would be because the pricing is outrageous or because I’m sick of the fact that Americans get everything weeks or months in advance.
I think it’s good that there are people who pirate out there, because it is slowly but surely disciplining the associated industries.

Read full topic

[quote=“Speljohan, post:14, topic:329461”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=425849.msg3128861#msg3128861 date=1266261842]

It’s common to read comments like “I buy the CD at the store, place it on my shelf, torrent the content and then enjoy it”.

Excuses. Why wouldn’t they just buy it in digital format?

Probably DRM, that’s the reason I wouldn’t buy content in digital format, because I wouldn’t be able to play them under linux.
[/quote]I dont know where you heard that bullshit, i have downloaded plenty of music digitally and i can share it as much as i want event if it is illegal[/quote]

I know of very few places you can buy digital music without DRM. Most of them have it don’t they?

item.title: MooZar Aims To Turn Pirates Into Paying Customers
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

This is actually something a lot of people often remark about; the pirates know that the artists will stop producing if they don’t receive sufficient income, but they have no method of payment. It’s common to read comments like “I buy the CD at the store, place it on my shelf, torrent the content and then enjoy it”. It seems that a common catalyst to piracy is the opportunity to avoid the retarded SNAFU of DRM and regioning and the like.
ITT: Major ignorance ('cept for speljohan_ <3)

Read full topic
item.source: MooZar Aims To Turn Pirates Into Paying Customers
